page.title: 07Artists/Craftsmen in Kelso
page.content: In Kelso there are many well-known artists and craftsmen. Our art teacher {Mr McDermid}is a great{artist}who makes models as well as painting. He has paintings in galleries all over the Borders.{Norman Cherry}is a local {silversmith.}He uses precious metals like gold, platinum and silver to make all kinds of jewellery, like rings, necklaces and earrings. I often wonder how many jewels he makes a day.{Andrew {Binnie}is an{artist}who paints pictures of Border landscapes. We have a{blacksmith, Dennis Mitchell,}who makes horseshoes and ornamental metal gates and signs.{Anne Carrick makes {dolls}in Kelso. She is qualified as a theatrical designer. She makes the dolls from wire frames and cloth. The dolls are sewn by machine and hand. She makes historical dolls of people from Scottish stories and poems.
